content: @Jakob von Raumer I added mkAppOptM' and mkAppM' which take an Expr instead of a constant name.
Thank you, that was fast! :happy:
Jakob von Raumer has marked this topic as resolved.
Hmm, why do I only get [Meta.appBuilder] (trace hidden) messages when I try to turn on the trace.Meta.appBuilder?
Can you interact with the messages? This is part of the new widget UI, but I haven't used it myself yet.
Nope, maybe I need to update the vscode-plugin?

@Jakob von Raumer I have the same problem when using VS Code. @Wojciech Nawrocki I have been assuming the PR you are working on will fix this issue, am I correct?
Jakob: The issue does not affect Emacs.

Yes, we are hiding the traces by default under the assumption that they computationally intensive to produce. But perhaps there should be an option to turn that off, or we should turn it off if widgets aren't available. In any case, yes, the new plugin will show the trace.
